snippet: The Supreme Court heard arguments in a case with possible implications for deals made in order to ease unionization efforts.
abstract: Supreme Court hears arguments in major labor case that, depending on how it is resolved, could hamper the ability of unions to mount successful campaigns to organize workers; case concerns deals in which employers aid unionization drives in exchange for labor peace, sometimes called 'neutrality agreements;' case involves union and Florida racetrack and casino Mardi Gras Gaming.
lead_paragraph: The Supreme Court heard arguments in a case with possible implications for deals made in order to ease unionization efforts.

headline.main: Court Considers ‘Neutrality Agreements’ Between Unions and Employers
headline.print_headline: Court Considers ‘Neutrality Agreements’ Between Unions and Employers
